alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 5:22AM MST until March 02 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT MOUNTAIN PASSES... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Clark Fork, Orin-Rice Road, Eastport, Priest River, Ione, Colville, Flowery Trail Road, Sandpoint, Newport, Metaline Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Metaline, Kettle Falls, Athol, Springdale-Hunters Road, Deer Park, Fruitland, Chewelah, Bonners Ferry, Tiger, and Northport. * WHEN...Until Noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions during the the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most significant travel impacts are expected this morning. Snow and graupel showers will continue into the afternoon, but temperatures warming into the 30s will decrease snow accumulation efficiency.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
